content.description:
This is an extension of

Big Birch

that starts about 10 feet further left of the original line. Start on a huge jug and move through sloping crimps to set up for a big throw to the "knob" about the same area as the start hold. Continue on through

Big Birch

and top out.
content.location: There's a downclimb on the west side of the boulder where you can hop down. This boulder's also near the creek and north-facing, so it's a good bit cooler and in the shade.

content.description: Sit start with hands matched on a bulbous edge feature. From there, make a big move to the rail, match, (traversing out left is off) hit the lip, and mantle on top.
content.protection: A pair of pads will work well. The landing is flat, but there is some shrubbery behind the fall zone.
content.location: It climbs the west face of Grey Eagle.

content.description:
Main Street Bench traverses a sloping, sandy lip and finishes with a tough mantle onto a slab.

Sit start with hands matched on the large shelf. From there, follow the lip up and right on slopers and bumps, reach the broken shelf, crank a heel and rock onto the slab, and top it out.
content.protection: A few pads will work. The landing is flat and clear.

content.description:
Use the same start as the

Big Birch

problem, but instead of traversing right, you'll move straight up off the shelf on a pair of solid crimps.
content.protection: Good landing, but a pad and spot wouldn't hurt.
content.location: This is on the North face of the Grey Eagle Boulder.

content.description:
Grey Eagle climbs an overhang via big moves over a poor landing.

Sit start with a right hand undercling, left hand sidepull (in the vertical crack), and an awkward right heel hook. Pull up, make a big right hand move to the large shelf, stick the featured sloper/crack with the left, bump the left up to the jug, throw a heel onto the shelf, and finish the remainder on the bumps and edges.
content.protection: At least two pads, there is a large rock directly behind the problem.
content.location: It climbs the south face of Grey Eagle.

content.description: Sit start from a nice undercling and sidepull, move up to the huge diagonal shelf, follow the shelf on good bumps and slopers, and top it out when it ends.
content.protection: Pad and a spot, great landing though.
content.location: This is on the North face of Grey Eagle Boulder.
